    • Method Detail

      • register

        boolean register(java.lang.Class<?> serviceClass,
                 java.lang.String nickName)
        Registers a class on JCL so it can be executed later.
        Parameters:
        serviceClass - The class to be executed remotely
        nickName - The class name to be used by JCL
        Returns:
        True if it is registered, false otherwise
        See Also:
        register(File[] jars, String classToBeExecuted)

      • register

        boolean register(java.io.File[] jars,
                 java.lang.String nickName)
        Registers JAR files and it's class to be executed later on JCL.
        Parameters:
        jars - The array of jars files necessary to execute a class remotely. The first jar file is the user application. The remaining are dependencies.
        nickName - The class name to be used by JCL. just the simple name. no packages. no .class extension.
        Returns:
        True if it is registered, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        register(Class, String)

      • unRegister

        boolean unRegister(java.lang.String nickName)
        Unregisters a class or a JAR file by it's nickname.
        Parameters:
        nickName - of the class, jar component to be removed by JCL. The nickName most be the same used in register method.
        Returns:
        True if it is removed, false otherwise.

      • execute

        java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result> execute(java.lang.String nickName,
                                                java.lang.Object... args)
        Execute a class method("execute") from the class that was register in one core member of the cluster in distributed/parallel version or in one core of the local processor in parallel version. To use this method the register Class most have a method named "execute".
        Parameters:
        nickName - - Class name defined by the developer in register phase. register(Class, String)
        args - - The method parameters values
        Returns:
        The task id, used to get the result asynchronously (Future.get() or future.get(time)).
        See Also:
        execute(String, String, Object... args)

      • execute

        java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result> execute(java.lang.String nickName,
                                                java.lang.String methodName,
                                                java.lang.Object... args)
        Execute a specific method from the object received using its arguments.
        Parameters:
        nickName - - The full class name, i.e., .class file name defined by the developer in register phase. register(Class, String)
        methodName - - The object method name to be executed.
        args - - The method parameters values.
        Returns:
        The task id, used to get the result asynchronously (Future.get() or future.get(time)).
        See Also:
        execute(String, Object...)

      • getAllResultBlocking

        java.util.List<JCL_result> getAllResultBlocking(java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result>> tickets)
        Get all method result from JCL list ID or a wait condition. If a wait condition is obtained, the caller is blocked. until the result arrives or a timeout is achieved.
        Parameters:
        tickets - - List of task identification.
        Returns:
        The list of result OR an error.

      • getAllResultUnblocking

        java.util.List<JCL_result> getAllResultUnblocking(java.util.List<java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result>> tickets)
        Get all method result or null. The caller is never blocked. Asynchronous get of results.
        Parameters:
        tickets - - List of task identification.
        Returns:
        The list of result or error or null. Null indicate processing.

      • removeResult

        JCL_result removeResult(java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result> ticket)
        Removes a result from the JCL.
        Parameters:
        ticket - The task name or the task id in asynchronous executions
        Returns:
        The removed result. null if no such result exists.

      • instantiateGlobalVar

        boolean instantiateGlobalVar(java.lang.Object key,
                             java.lang.String varName,
                             java.io.File[] jars,
                             java.lang.Object[] defaultVarValue)
        Creates a global variable with a user defined key, user typed according to jar files and a class name varName. The args array sets user variable initial values used in constructor of the class. The class name varName must be equal the .class file in the jar file.
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier.
        varName - - The variable name. varName must be equal the .class file in the jar file.
        jars - - jars files with varName class.
        defaultVarValue - - The default variable value.
        Returns:
        Return the instance if the variable is created. null otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVar(Object key, Object instance), deleteGlobalVar(Object key)

      • instantiateGlobalVar

        boolean instantiateGlobalVar(java.lang.Object key,
                             java.lang.Object instance)
        Creates a global variable a user defined key. JCL uses the user object instance instead of creating an instance internally. It does not works with user types. Only Java types.
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier.
        instance - - A user variable value.
        Returns:
        Return true if the variable is registered. False otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVar(Object key, String varName, File[] jars, Object[] defaultVarValue), deleteGlobalVar(Object key)

      • deleteGlobalVar

        boolean deleteGlobalVar(java.lang.Object key)
        Removes a user global variable with key identifier from JCL. If the variable is previously locked the destroy will return false. the user must unlock first and destroy after.
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier
        Returns:
        Return true if the variable is set null. False otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVar(Object key, String varName, File[] jars, Object[] defaultVarValue), instantiateGlobalVar(Object key, Object instance)

      • setValueUnlocking

        boolean setValueUnlocking(java.lang.Object key,
                          java.lang.Object value)
        Updates the variable value. Unlock a variable if it is previously locked.
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier
        value - - Global variable value
        Returns:
        True if value is correctly updated or false otherwise
        See Also:
        setValueUnlocking(Object key, Object value)

      • getValue

        JCL_result getValue(java.lang.Object key)
        Gets a variable varName value
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier
        Returns:
        The global variable value or an error or null if no variable exists
        See Also:
        getValue(Object key)

      • getValueLocking

        JCL_result getValueLocking(java.lang.Object key)
        Gets a variable varName value and locks varName access. This is a simple implementation of critical sections. The variable is locked and writed by a single process until a setValueUnlocking(Object key, Object) call. Other processes can only read such a variable, using JCL getValue(Object key) method
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier
        Returns:
        The global variable value or an error or null if no variable exists. If there is a correct value, the JCL_Result also stores a lock ticket, used to set a value or simple unlock the variable. the pair getValueLocking and setValueUnlocking implements critical sections in JCL.
        See Also:
        getValueLocking(Object key)

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        destroy JCL_user class. Use in the end of JCL program.

      • containsTask

        boolean containsTask(java.lang.String nickName)
        Verify if there is a task registered in JCL.
        Parameters:
        nickName - the task identifier.
        Returns:
        true if JCL contains such a task, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        containsGlobalVar(Object key)

      • containsGlobalVar

        key - - The variable identifier.
        Returns:
        True if JCL contains such a global variable, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        containsTask(String)

      • isLock

        boolean isLock(java.lang.Object key)
        Verify if the global variable is lock getValueLocking(Object)
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier.
        Returns:
        return true if global variable is lock or false if global variable is unlock. boolean isLock(String varName).

      • getDevices

        java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getDevices()
        gets a list with all "high-end" devices in the cluster. "High-end" devices are devices that can do storage, general purpose computing and others.
        Returns:
        a list with all "high-end" devices in the cluster

      • getDeviceCore

        int getDeviceCore(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> device)
        The number of core of the specified host.
        Parameters:
        device - - the specified device Format: Entry of "alias name , HOSTIDIPPORT".
        Returns:
        the number of core.
        See Also:
        getDevices()

      • getAllDevicesCores

        java.util.Map<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>,java.lang.Integer> getAllDevicesCores()
        Get list of registered Hosts with the number of cores. Format: Entry of "alias name , HOSTIDIPPORT", "number of cores"
        Returns:
        The Map with host as key and number of cores as value.
        See Also:
        getDevices()

      • instantiateGlobalVarOnDevice

        java.lang.Object instantiateGlobalVarOnDevice(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> device,
                                              java.lang.String nickname,
                                              java.lang.Object key,
                                              java.io.File[] jars,
                                              java.lang.Object[] defaultVarValue)
        Creates a global variable in a specific host with name equals nickName, user typed according to jar files and a class name varName. The args array sets user variable initial values. The class name varName must be equal the .class file in the jar file.
        Parameters:
        device - - Entry of "alias name , HOSTIDIPPORT".
        nickname - - The user nickname. varName must be equal the .class file in the jar file.
        key - - The variable key.
        jars - - Jars file with nickname class.
        defaultVarValue - - The default variable value.
        Returns:
        Return the instance if the variable is created. null otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVar(Object key, Object instance), deleteGlobalVar(Object key)

      • instantiateGlobalVarOnDevice

        boolean instantiateGlobalVarOnDevice(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> device,
                                     java.lang.Object key,
                                     java.lang.Object instance)
        Creates a global variable in a specific host with name equals varName. JCL uses the user object instance instead of creating an instance internally. It does not works with user types. Only Java types.
        Parameters:
        device - - Entry of "alias name , HOSTIDIPPORT".
        key - - The variable key.
        instance - - A user variable value.
        Returns:
        Return true if the variable is registered. False otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVar(Object key, String varName, File[] jars, Object[] defaultVarValue), deleteGlobalVar(Object key)

      • instantiateGlobalVarAsy

        java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> instantiateGlobalVarAsy(java.lang.Object key,
                                                                       java.lang.Object instance)
        Creates a global variable with name equals key. JCL uses the user object instance instead of creating an instance internally. It does not works with user types. Only Java types.Return Future > Boolean <, so this method is asynchronous, to lock use Future.get().
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier.
        instance - - A user variable object.
        Returns:
        Return Future > Boolean < true if the variable is registered. False otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVar(Object key, String varName, File[] jars, Object[] defaultVarValue), deleteGlobalVar(Object key)

      • instantiateGlobalVarAsy

        java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> instantiateGlobalVarAsy(java.lang.Object key,
                                                                       java.lang.String varName,
                                                                       java.io.File[] jars,
                                                                       java.lang.Object[] defaultVarValue)
        Creates a global variable with name equals key, user typed according to jar files and a class name varName. The args array sets user variable initial values. The class name varName must be equal the .class file in the jar file. Return Future Boolean, so this method is asynchronous to lock use Future.get().
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier.
        varName - - The variable name. varName must be equal the .class file in the jar file.
        jars - - jars files with varName class.
        defaultVarValue - - The default variable value.
        Returns:
        Return Future interface.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVar(Object key, Object instance), deleteGlobalVar(Object key)

      • instantiateGlobalVar

        boolean instantiateGlobalVar(java.lang.Object key,
                             java.lang.Object instance,
                             java.lang.String classVar,
                             boolean Registers)
        Creates a global variable with name equals key. JCL uses the user object instance instead of creating an instance internally.
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier.
        instance - - A user variable value.
        classVar - - User type previously registered.
        Registers - - true try to register.
        Returns:
        Return true if the variable is registered. False otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVar(Object key, String varName, File[] jars, Object[] defaultVarValue), deleteGlobalVar(Object key)

      • execute

        java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result> execute(JCL_task task)
        Execute a class method from the class that was register in one core member of the cluster in distributed/parallel version or in one core of the local processor in parallel version.
        Parameters:
        task - - JCL_task that contain all task info. register(Class, String)
        Returns:
        The task id, used to get the result asynchronously.
        See Also:
        execute(String, String, Object... args)

      • executeOnDevice

                                                        java.lang.String objectNickname,
                                                        java.lang.String methodName,
                                                        java.lang.Object[] args)

        device - - Entry of "alias name , HOSTIDIPPORT". getDevices()
        objectNickname - - The object nickname defined by the developer
        args - - The method parameters values
        Returns:
        The task id, used to get the result asynchronously.

      • instantiateGlobalVarAsy

        java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Boolean> instantiateGlobalVarAsy(java.lang.Object key,
                                                                       java.lang.Object instance,
                                                                       java.lang.String classVar,
                                                                       boolean Registers)
        Creates a global variable with name equals key. JCL uses the user object instance instead of creating an instance internally. Return Future > Boolean <, so this method is asynchronous, to lock use Future.get().
        Parameters:
        key - - The variable identifier.
        instance - - A user variable object.
        Returns:
        Return Future > Boolean < true if the variable is registered. False otherwise.
        See Also:
        instantiateGlobalVarAsy(Object key, Object instance, String classVar, boolean Registers), deleteGlobalVar(Object key)
